required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Basket Study of Pyrotinib Maleate for HER2-Postive Solid Tumor
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Phase 2 Study of Pyrotinib Maleate in Advanced Solid Tumors Patients With HER2( Erb-B2 Receptor Tyrosine Kinase 2)-Postive

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, Phase 2 study exploring the efficacy and safety of 马来酸Pyrotinib Maleate Tablets in patients with solid tumors with activating（harmful） HER2 mutations or with HER2 gene amplification or immunohistochemical staining (IHC) assay showing HER2 is 3+ and / or fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) positive.

primary_outcome.description: Objective response rate defined as the patients confirmed complete response or partial response under RECIST 1.0 criteria.

secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival estimated using Kaplan-Meier methods is defined as the time from registration to the earlier of death or disease progression
The first evaluation of treatment efficacy is the time fromcomplete response or partial response to the first assessment of disease progression or death from any cause.
Objective response rate defined as the patients confirmed complete response or partial response or stable disease under RECIST 1.0 criteria.
Overall survival estimated using Kaplan-Meier methods is defined as the time from treatment initiation to death by any cause

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety (Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events)
secondary_outcome.description: From consent through 28 days following treatment completion (estimated 6 months)

arm_group.description: This arm for HER2-postive solid tumor

intervention.description: 400 mg administered orally, once daily, continuously in 21 day cycles
